lead_paragraph: As light pollution from large metropolitan areas seeps across the country, Westcliffe, Colo., has made being a dark place central to its allure.

headline.print_headline: Colorado Towns Work to Preserve a Diminishing Resource: Darkness
headline.main: Colorado Towns Work to Preserve a Diminishing Resource: Darkness

snippet: As light pollution from large metropolitan areas seeps across the country, Westcliffe, Colo., has made being a dark place central to its allure....
abstract: Neighboring towns of Westcliffe and Silver Cliff in Colorado have, for over decade, instituted rules and suggested practices in effort to persuade residents to reduce light pollution, earning them designation as dark-sky communities by nonprofit International Dark-Sky Association; only handful of towns in United States have received designation, and amateur stargazers come to take advantage of dark.
